content:
Great, I'll keep track of your shopping list. Here's what you have so far:

* Individually Quick Frozen Vegetables: mixed veggies (cauliflower, carrots, green beans, mixed peppers, spinach, and asparagus)
* Individually Quick Frozen Fruits: mixed berries, peaches, and blueberries
* Protein: boneless skinless chicken thighs, ground beef, and pea protein powder
* Whole Grains: quinoa, brown rice, and whole wheat pasta
* Dairy: low-fat Greek yogurt and reduced-fat cheese
* Healthy Fats: avocado, almonds, and dark chocolate chips
* Herbs and Spices: garlic, ginger, cumin, paprika, dried oregano, and dried thyme

For creating quick, healthy air fryer meals, here are some ideas based on the ingredients you have available:

1. Air Fryer Chicken Thighs with Quinoa and Roasted Vegetables:
* Season the chicken thighs with garlic, ginger, cumin, and paprika.
* Cook the chicken thighs in the air fryer until crispy.
* Cook quinoa according to package instructions and set aside.
* Toss mixed veggies in olive oil, salt, and dried thyme and roast in the air fryer.
* Serve chicken thighs with quinoa and roasted veggies.
1. Air Fryer Ground Beef and Veggie Stir-Fry:
* Cook ground beef in the air fryer until browned.
* Add mixed veggies and cook until tender.
* Season with garlic, ginger, and soy sauce.
* Serve with brown rice.
1. Air Fryer Peach and Berry Crisp:
* Mix frozen peaches and berries in a bowl and top with a mixture of oats, almonds, and dark chocolate chips.
* Cook in the air fryer until bubbly and crisp.

I hope these ideas help you create quick and healthy meals using your air fryer and the ingredients you have available. Let me know if you have any questions or need further assistance.
